snippet: A case questions whether the F.C.C. is able to set time limits to build or alter wireless facilities and whether it has the jurisdiction to do so.
abstract: Supreme Court case from two Texas cities questions whether Federal Communications Commission is able to set time limits for telecommunications companies to build or alter cellphone towers and whether it has the jurisdiction to do so.
lead_paragraph: A case questions whether the F.C.C. is able to set time limits to build or alter wireless facilities and whether it has the jurisdiction to do so.

headline.seo: Supreme Court Hears Argument on Cellphone Towers
headline.main: Supreme Court Hears Argument on the F.C.C.’s Authority to Rule on Cellphone Towers
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Hears Argument on the F.C.C.’s Authority to Rule on Cellphone Towers
